## Summary of Article: EU Countries | European Union

**Key Facts:**

This article provides a list of the 27 current European Union member states and their participation dates in various EU institutions:

**Member States Listed:**
1. Austria (EU: 1995, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1997)
2. Belgium (EU: 1958, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1995)
3. Bulgaria (EU: 2007, Euro: 2026, Schengen: 2024)
4. Croatia (EU: 2013, Euro: 2023, Schengen: 2023)
5. Cyprus (EU: 2004, Euro: 2008)
6. Czechia (EU: 2004, Schengen: 2007)
7. Denmark (EU: 1973, Schengen: 2001)
8. Estonia (EU: 2004, Euro: 2011, Schengen: 2007)
9. Finland (EU: 1995, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 2001)
10. France (EU: 1958, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1995)
11. Germany (EU: 1958, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1995)
12. Greece (EU: 1981, Euro: 2001, Schengen: 2000)
13. Hungary (EU: 2004, Schengen: 2007)
14. Ireland (EU: 1973, Euro: 1999)
15. Italy (EU: 1958, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1997)
16. Latvia (EU: 2004, Euro: 2014, Schengen: 2007)
17. Lithuania (EU: 2004, Euro: 2015, Schengen: 2007)
18. Luxembourg (EU: 1958, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1995)
19. Malta (EU: 2004, Euro: 2008, Schengen: 2007)
20. Netherlands (EU: 1958, Euro: 1999, Schengen: 1995)

**Note:** The article appears to be truncated and only lists 20 of the 27 EU member states. The remaining 7 member states (Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden) are not included in the extracted content.

**Relevance to Forecast Question:** This article confirms the current composition of the EU, establishing which territories would qualify for the resolution criteria of the forecasting question.
